e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards and provides a true representation of the company’s financial performance. While it may create initial confusion among some investors, the long-term benefits of transparency and integrity will likely foster greater trust and investor confidence, mitigating potential legal risks associated with the current biased reporting.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness in presenting financial information. Key characteristics include unbiased reporting that reflects the true financial performance of the company, clear communication of any adjustments or practices to investors, and adherence to legal regulations. Additionally, taking into account the varying levels of financial literacy among investors is crucial, as this informs how information is presented and ensures all stakeholders are adequately informed.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate the change in the reporting policy to investors and what strategies they will employ to address potential misunderstandings. Additionally, I would inquire about measures they intend to take to ensure all investors, especially retail ones, can easily understand the financial statements moving forward.
